ADVENTURE_HOOK: {{ADVENTURE_HOOK}}, action must be performed during the event "{{EVENT}}"
ANIMAL: Granjoro Jellyfish (10' diameter, look it up)

CASTLE_CACHTICE_INHABITANT.18: March Hare about to deliver message from House of Hearts to Pale King
CASTLE_CACHTICE_INHABITANT.19: Hatter delivering message from Pale King
CASTLE_CACHTICE_INHABITANT.20: Knight delivering message to Colorless Queen
CASTLE_CACHTICE_INHABITANT.21: Red Bishop delivering message from Red King
CASTLE_CACHTICE_INHABITANT.41: Old relative of Queen or King
CASTLE_CACHTICE_INHABITANT.47: Keymaster (has key to each room except Hall of Hissing Statues)
CASTLE_CACHTICE_INHABITANT.63: Sphinx (lurking, trying to get into library)

DIAMOND_JOB: Old relative of Queen or King

EVENT.10: Fierce battle between Red and Heart forces in square {{RANDOM_HEX}}.
EVENT.23: {{OBJECT}} stolen at Heart Queen's croquet game.
EVENT.42: Massive battle- disastrous for both Heart and Red sides- forecluded.
EVENT.43: Massive battle- disastrous for all four sides- forecluded.
EVENT.44: Negotiations between House of Hearts and Pale House.
EVENT.45: Negotiations between House of Hearts and Colorless House.
EVENT.46: Negotiations between Red House and Pale House.
EVENT.47: Negotiations between Red House and Colorless House.
EVENT.48: Combined Pale and Colorless forces attack Red House on field of battle.
EVENT.49: Combined Pale and Colorless forces attack House of Hearts on field of battle.
EVENT.50: Combined Heart and Pale forces attack Red House.
EVENT.51: Combined Heart and Colorless forces attack Red House.
EVENT.52: Combined Red and Pale forces attack Hearts.
EVENT.53: Combined Red and Colorless forces attack Hearts.
EVENT.55: Jabberwock sighted in square {{RANDOM_HEX}}; hunting party sent from {{HOUSE}} to capture it.
EVENT.56: {{ENCOUNTER_INTELLIGENT}} framed by Tizala (Red Bride) for slaying another bride.
EVENT.57: Red Bride Ildana caught attempting to slay Red King.
EVENT.58: Pale King has spotted the Unicorn and is pursuing it.
EVENT.59: Pale King has spotted the Sphinx and is pursuing it.
EVENT.60: Nyvian, the Colorless Queen, has been seen having tea with the Hatter.
EVENT.62: Nyvian, the Colorless Queen, has been seen with the Red Bride, Tizala.
EVENT.63: Nyvian, the Colorless Queen, has been seen with the Red Bride, Ildanna.
EVENT.64: Rabbit found dead with enigmatic communique, suggesting betrayal of the House of Hearts.
EVENT.65: Cheshire Cat seen in the halls of the Looking Glass Palace.
EVENT.66: Hatter on trial in the Card Castle.
EVENT.67: Hatter has advised the Pale King to join the Red King.
EVENT.68: Hatter has advised the Pale King to join the Heart Queen.
EVENT.69: Hatter has advised the Pale King to join the Colorless Queen.
EVENT.70: Hatter has fixed his watch and now his power is frightening.
EVENT.71: Hare has opened negotiations between the Pale House and Hearts.
EVENT.72: Doormouse found dead with mysterious message to Knave.
EVENT.75: A Decapitated Lord has been recapitated.
EVENT.76: One of the Pale King's recipe books is missing; the Knave is suspected.
EVENT.77: Knight of each house found dead in a locked room with the Pseudoturtle.
EVENT.79: King of Hearts executed by Heart Queen. Her forces are expected to suffer on the field of battle.
EVENT.81: {{ENCOUNTER_INTELLIGENT}} discovered in compromisingly intimate congress with {{ENCOUNTER_INTELLIGENT}}.
EVENT.85: Red King's forces have established a small fortress on square {{RANDOM_HEX}}.
EVENT.89: Heart Queen's forces have established a small fortress on square {{RANDOM_HEX}}.
EVENT.91: Scribes say a strange and valuable {{OBJECT}} is located somewhere in the interior beneath square {{RANDOM_HEX}}: all sides are scrambling through the interiors to find it.
EVENT.92: Plague of foot and mouth disease ravaging horses on both sides.
EVENT.97: Time distortion freezes time in square {{RANDOM_HEX}} for one week, d4 {{ENCOUNTER_INTELLIGENT}}[s] caught in it.
EVENT.98: Time distortion causes reverse battle between Heart and Red forces, other houses scramble to use their knowledge of the fight (whose outcome they know) to un-save certain enemies.
EVENT.99: Heart battle plan secretly discovered by Red forces.
EVENT.100: Red battle plan secretly discovered by Heart forces.

FOREST_LANDMARK: Stitch in space- Settlement in the distance
Peak see 12-20 miles in all directions
Peak see 12-20 miles in all directions
Hill see 9 miles in all directions
Section of interior {{INTERIOR_ROOM}} filled in with water
GARDEN_LANDMARK: Peak see 12-20 miles in all directions
Tall tower see 12-20 miles in every direction
Peak see 12-20 miles in all directions
Small fortified section of exposed interior {{INTERIOR_ROOM}}
Hill see 9 miles in all directions
Section of interior {{INTERIOR_ROOM}} filled in with water
INTERIOR_ROOM: All entrances to here are concealed
A battle was just fought here
COMPLICATION: Spatial distortion: walk away from target location to reach it
Time distortion: 25% of rounds are undone afterward (Warning: this is a pain to Referee, but fun)
Time distortion: move forward by staying still and occupying square

Name loss. Anyone passing through this square must make a Wisdom check or else lose their name. They will not be able to remember it, neither will anyone else, and no targeted spell or ritual will affect them (including beneficial ones)- though area effect spells still can. One can regain one's name by finding a village and being rechristened (their real name will be remembered) or by committing a deed resulting in gaining at least half of the experience points needed to reach the next level and renaming yourself after the deed (Frederic the Larcenous, Morgotte Hogslayer, etc.). One cannot gain levels or be healed by Clerical magic without a name.
Spatial distortion: crossing square eastward leads north, west leads south and vice versa
Sunlight does not reach this square

LOCATION_FOREST.9: Stitch in space- Settlement in the distance

LOCATION_OTHER: {{LOCATION}} On Quiet Side of Looking Glass
OBJECT: Doll or workbox? Hard to tell. It's always in your peripheral vision.
Fruit with gears and mechanisms inside
Worldcube (like a globe except accurate because we all know the world is cube-shaped) fist-sized
Key. Roll d100. That's the percent chance it will fit any given lock. Once it fits a lock, that's the door it was for.
PERPLEXITY_COMMON: Doors all change position if characters return to this room
Has Anonymity (roll on Anonymities Table, p150)
Room tilted, characters walking through entrance end up walking on wall.
Room inverted, furniture and door aligned along ceiling, gravity still pulls "down" in same direction on both sides of the door, so characters must climb down to "ceiling".

Long bent hall or shaft turning left or right. After all characters have rounded the bend they will find there is no exit. After this happens, roll d4: - 1 An Anonymity appears - 2 Roll another Common Perplexity for this room - 3 Roll an Uncommon Perplexity for this room - 4 Roll a random Interior Encounter for this room. If resolving that doesn't get the characters out of the room, roll d4 again.
PERPLEXITY_UNCOMMON: Full of (Roll Objects).
Full of (Roll Animal).
Gravity pulls toward whichever of room's surfaces most of creature is closest to.
Inside-out room: like Castle Poenari, room 23.
Opposite side of door is another door in the same room. Example: walk out north, walk into the same room from the east.
Furniture fixed to ceiling--door not in "correct" place relative to furniture.
Furniture fixed to wall, roll direction randomly.
Furniture fixed to wall, roll direction randomly and gravity pulls up.
Furniture fixed to wall, roll direction randomly and gravity matches furniture.
Multiple doors, gravity always pulls in same direction as last opened door.
Window looking out on {{GARDEN_LANDMARK}} of garden.
Either the room is enormous or you just shrunk.
Furniture contains 3 Anonymities (roll).
Gravity pulls up.
Gravity pulls in random compass direction.
Wall looks like wood or stone but if something touches it, it ripples. Swimming through this watery wall reveals hidden room.

Wall looks like wood or stone but if something touches it, it ripples. Swimming through this watery wall reveals hidden room. With d4 Colorless 1-Pawn(s) 2-Knight(s) 3-Bishop(s) 4-Rook(s) 5-Queen 6-Roll twice lurking behind surface
Opening this door closes and locks all others.
Doors behind do not exist so long as a given door is open.
False doors.
Room shrinks 4' per round once entered.
Everything burned.
Chess match paused midway, 2 players in next room smoking.
Game of cards paused midway, d6+1 players scattered in nearby rooms.
Indoor croquet paused midway, 2d4 players searching nearby for lost ball.
Wargame paused midway, d4+1 players sleeping nearby.
Cavernous shaftway with bridge across, bridge has small guardhouse midway across.
Room contains large 3d model of Voivodja in pasteboard or gingerbread.
Tall, narrow shaft. A child or Pawn 2d4 stories up will drop croquet balls or hedgehogs on anyone investigating it.
Tall, narrow shaft. A child or Pawn 2d4 stories up will drop croquet balls or hedgehogs on anyone investigating it. Morgue or library. Mortician/librarian possibly present.
10' high tightrope to far door. Touching the floor causes sleep effect.
Filled with marmalade, waist deep
Everything in room is a stage flat, decayed and hastily painted.
Great paintings on the walls of various scenes from the Slow War. Act as portals to those places,: all other creatures are frozen. Items function normally.
Terraced to resemble a 3-dimensional Q*Bert-style chess board.
One enormous (roll Animal) stuck in room.
Shaft full of croquet balls, access to other levels below. Strength check per level descended, Constitution per level to avoid d12 damage from suffocation.
Filled with a slurry of pus, gore, vomit and viscera, waist deep.

Furnished cube room 40' on a side. In the floor is a right-angled pit, which is actually a 30' cube, 3/4 scale replica of the original room. Set into the floor of the 30' room is a 3/4 scale replica of the 30' room, and inside that one another and another etc. Looking up from the original room will reveal the 40' room is in a pit set in the floor of an identical, larger room, of which the 40' room is a 3/4 scale model, and that the larger room is set into the floor of a still larger room, etc. Doors function normally & lead to different places.
Empty, cracked swimming pool. A few small animals trapped at the bottom.
Logic distortions take a toll--Save vs magic or lose a point of Int until outside again.
{{OBJECT}} in room turns into {{OBJECT}}.
{{OBJECT}} in room turns into {{ANIMAL}}.
{{ANIMAL}} in room turns into {{OBJECT}}.

Inhabitants endlessly attempt to achieve the same immediate objective over and over. i.e. if they were climbing a ladder they must continue to climb a ladder (going down and starting over if necessary), if speaking, they must keep talking, etc.
Footmen are cleaning this room. Reason unclear.
Inhabitants' minds are moved to other creatures' bodies so long as they are in this room.
As 47 except effect lasts until vessel creature is slain.
Automata precisely resemble player characters.
Room stretched out to d100-story shaft.

Party sees dead versions of themselves filled with darts at other end of room (near only other exit). As they move toward center of room, the dead selves rise up and move backward like a rewound tape (at the same speed the party moves forward), poison darts leave their bodies and pull back into concealed barrels and the reverse-party moves back toward tripwires in the center of the room that activated the trap. Those within 2' of the wires searching the center of the room will see them. If a character steps past the wires (or activates them, springing the trap) his/her double crosses past their twin across the wires (exchanging positions) and backwards-walking away at the same speed the character moves forward.
Resembles nearest room in every detail, replicates all changes to that room, other than presence of characters.
Armies fighting a battle in the room.
Room on fire.
Totally random creatures emerge every round from one of the doors.
Room turns all occupants into children. They return to normal if they leave.
All surfaces are powerfully adhesive.
One wall is composed of glass. Giants look in through the glass.
Narrow bridge stretches over chasm filled with some Perplexity or mystery--opposing armies controls either side of the bridge. The far side is not in bow range.
Walls made of glass, at least on this side.
Close inspection reveals furniture is made of paper.
Room freezing cold, floor covered in ice.
Room is the back room of a merchant's shop.
All furniture on the backs of turtles or short servants.
Guest-summoning circle.
Windows show an unfamiliar night sky.
Ceiling is thick glass. Enemies above.
Enormous dying snail.
Arrow slits coming into room from every wall.
Arrow slits coming into room from every wall, those on opposing walls belong to opposed factions.
Medical files on nearby NPCs and creatures.
Biographies of nearby NPCs and creatures.
Fleshy grey spheres float in vats and range from grapefruit to cantaloupe size, covered in mouths. Each mouth whispers all the sins of a specific creature somewhere. Filing system in nearby room.
Room is the backstage of the next room. Seats in the adjacent room, perhaps occupied, and curtains along the sides.

3' wide corridor going left and right. "Corridor" is actually an interspace between the last room and a room--3' larger in every direction--it sits inside of. There is a slightly-larger version of anything that was on the walls of the last room. You can climb onto the roof of the previous room.

3' wide corridor going left and right. "Corridor" is actually an interspace between the last room and a room--3' larger in every direction--it sits inside of. There is a slightly-larger version of anything that was on the walls of the last room. You can climb onto the roof of the previous room. The effect keeps repeating d20 times. Walking out a door on the exterior of a larger room brings you to one with even larger furnishings.
Room spins in relation to rooms around it every time door is used--4 characters walking out single file will end up in 4 different places.
Tiny cities coat the floor like a thick rug. This room is their country.
4' ceiling. Soft floor beneath carpet. Inhabitants are in normal-sized room, standing on a huge pile of wall-to- wall carpets. Treasure beneath.
Knee-deep in random junk.
Small random object on fire on pedestal.
Inoffensive-looking creature. Personally responsible for all perplexities in the area.
Freshly cooked meal laid out. Harmless.

Objects (not including the walls, ceilings, floor or the statues themselves) immediately disappear from the room if the statues in the room cannot see them or something they are touching. Disappeared things appear in another room. It's possible to remove locked doors or other obstacles by blocking the statues' vision. A painting here reflects the aggregate of what all the statues can currently see in the room.
Room is bottom of 200' shaft. Things strewn about.
Maze corridors. If the characters keep going forward for 2 minutes they'll get out, but if they turn back they will find tigers behind the first turn.
Old, happily married version of random party member with kids occupies room. Implores party to stay.
Prep room for terrified cook or chef frantically preparing scones, shrewsbury cakes, etc. for a ravenous nearby Rook.
Larder for anthrovorous beast. Hogtied men and women in cubby holes.

Gender swapped versions of party are fighting gender- swapped versions of some recent foes in this room. Characters have to play gender-swapped versions of themselves to go further in this direction, but will turn back to their original selves once they come back through.
Replica of room from a long-ago incident in the campaign.
Gender-changed-, child-, or aged- version of character challenges character to a duel. Player must play the new character if s/he loses.
Small doppleganger begins following characters-- taking notes on their abilities and voice tics, spells, combat tactics, etc. It has no immediate plan to attack.
Shoes tastefully displayed. Obsequious {{ENCOUNTER_INTELLIGENT}} appears and attempt to sell them to the party, commenting on the worn quality of their current footwear.

{{ENCOUNTER_INTELLIGENT}} owns puppets of major political forces and monsters in Voivodja. For 2 gp, s/he will put on a puppet show featuring a creature of the customer's choice. The show will be silent but the events portrayed will be wholly accurate.
Talking sloth seeks to book passage on character to nearby room. Will pay.
Museum room--displays explain various facts about the Place in Old Voivodish.
Room offers a view of-, but no direct passage to-, events in a nearby room.

Gingerbread maze matching layout of nearby fortified rooms--eating walls or floors will destroy the real rooms or floors in the complex and throw the enemy into disarray. The gingerbread maze has no figures or other markers clarifying the relationship to the real rooms.

3' pool with 6" wide canals extending through the walls into various other rooms in the interior. The pool is filled with messages in bottles. Senders' names clearly visible from outside the bottles. Read any note and the others are gone next time you look down.

NPC_RELATIONSHIP.2: NPC is toying with _____ or using it/she/he for entertainment
NPC_RELATIONSHIP.6: NPC has an uneasy alliance with...
NPC_RELATIONSHIP.28: NPC cannot sense _____ and this is dangerous
NPC_RELATIONSHIP.32: NPC does not want to harm ______ but feels s/he must
NPC_RELATIONSHIP.36: NPC requires _____ as a raw material for some magical/psychic alchemical scheme
NPC_RELATIONSHIP.40: NPC wants to attack _____ but is bound by some thing not to do so directly
NPC_RELATIONSHIP.44: NPC is being pressured to ally with...
NPC_RELATIONSHIP.46: NPC wants to frame _____ or otherwise have his/her/its actions mistaken for his/her/ its own
NPC_RELATIONSHIP.48: NPC must distract _____ in order to enact plan
NPC_RELATIONSHIP.52: NPC will be unstoppable once allied with...
NPC_RELATIONSHIP.54: NPC will be more vulnerable once allied with...
NPC_RELATIONSHIP.56: NPC wants to be rescued from...
NPC_RELATIONSHIP.66: NPC just killed/is about to kill...
NPC_RELATIONSHIP.81: NPC is or wants to perform experiments on...
NPC_RELATIONSHIP.83: NPC requires _____ to complete a work of art
NPC_RELATIONSHIP.93: NPC is struggling with ... for control of an organization
NPC_RELATIONSHIP.95: NPC is unaware of but vulnerable to ...

DOING_RELATIONSHIP: is hunting with the aid of {{ANIMAL_ENCOUNTER}}
DOING_WANT: wants to get into or out of Interior
wants revenge on {{ENCOUNTER_INTERIOR}} in the Interior
wants a fantastic treasure hoard they believe to be located nearby
wants the character with the highest Charisma
wants a magic item believed to be in the Interior; either one you already put in there, or a regular item that this loser thinks is magical
wants to desecrate one of the altars
wants to stir up dissent within occupying factions of {{ENCOUNTER_INTERIOR}} in the Interior
wants to locate the rest of his/her party
wants to invent preposterous but plausible objectives to keep the characters busy while s/he bumps them off one by one
wants to slay and replace the head of faction of {{ENCOUNTER_INTERIOR}} in the Interior
DOING_CARE: NPC secretly or overtly controls a powerful faction in the interior
NPC demonstrates extensive knowledge of much that is hidden- and will reveal more in exchange for aid
NPC has a bad temper, and a map of the local Interior
NPC is on good terms with powerful creature in the Interior and can get the characters past it
NPC has oracular powers or is a Cleric with a few Cure Moderate Wounds up his/her embroidered sleeves
NPC is in a position to offer the characters a sizable monetary reward once they are safely out of the Interior
NPC is delivering a message to one of the kings or queens and if they are interrupted the characters will suffer
NPC is valuable if captured alive and brought to a wealthy patron
NPC knows the code to interpret the message s/he carries
